customize.text:
During the cataclysm, Dainsleif was cursed with immortality by Celestia. He was one of the six people who should have prevented the disaster and stopped the Vinster King from continuing to rock the foundation of the world. His main goal is to stop the Abyss Order.

The Traveler's sibling and the Princess/Prince of the Abyss Order, who used to be Dainsleif's companion.

customize.text: Voice-Over

<color=#ffd780>About Dainsleif</color>
At one time, he was Master's rival. At another, they were best friends, apparently... I had hoped he might give me some more information about Master, but the moment he recognized my style of bladework, he got very agitated and demanded to know Master's whereabouts. I don't want to deal with him. Hopefully I don't run into him again any time soon.
Traveler's Twin
Dialogues

<color=#ffd780>About Dainsleif</color>
That man, Dainsleif, was the "Twilight Sword," one of the royal guards of the final dynasty of Khaenri'ah. 500 years ago, he failed to prevent the destruction of Khaenri'ah.
A curse of immortality was laid upon him, to forever wander the wilderness... while he watched the people he was supposed to protect turn into the monsters of the Abyss.

customize.name: Halfdan
customize.desc: An elite in the Royal Guard of Khaenri'ah under the Twilight Sword's command.

customize.text: Dialogues

<color=#ffd780>About Khaenri'ah</color>
<color=#37ffff>Halfdan</color> : Apologies, Captain Dainsleif, Twilight Sword. Back then... I failed you, and failed to protect our people
<color=#37ffff>Dainsleif</color> : No, for five hundred years, you have faithfully done your duty
<color=#37ffff>Dainsleif</color> : To this day, I am proud of you all
<color=#37ffff>Halfdan</color> : Khaenri'ah... didn't fall, did it? Since you're still here...
<color=#37ffff>Dainsleif</color> : Correct
<color=#37ffff>Dainsleif</color> : So... no need to revive the homeland
The Cataclysm

Over five hundred years ago, the "Twilight Sword" Dainsleif was the captain of the royal guard of Khaenri'ah, an unprecedented, flourishing, and powerful nation built entirely by humans. When his older brother, Vedrfolnir, was blinded in both eyes and imprisoned for giving an oracle, Dainsleif gathered the brilliant young ones of the age, "The Wise" Hroptatyr, "The Visionary" Vedrfolnir, "Gold" Rhinedottir, "The Foul" Surtalogi, and "Rächer of Solnari" Rerir, to save him. They were once people of great esteem in Khaenri'ah, those who carried the hopes of the nation. According to the plan, the six of them were supposed to prevent a catastrophe and stop the Vinster King from continuing to rock the foundation of the world. But deep down, five of them wanted more and could not resist the call of the Abyss, so they divided the power capable of destroying the entire world among themselves. Vedrfolnir, Rhinedottir, Hroptatyr, Rerir, and Surtalogi became the Sinners — transcendent beings, each in possession of world-shattering power. And when disaster struck, only Dainsleif stood up to protect his people. When King Irmin and the sages tore the veil of sin, and monsters from the Abyss created by Rhinedottir filled Teyvat, the Heavenly Principles sent the Archons of the seven kingdoms to Khaenri'ah, and the nation without gods itself was destroyed.
<color=#ffffffd9>"The 'pride of humankind' was uprooted and crushed, like a weed removed from the garden of the gods…"</color>

Along with the guards, the Twilight Sword defended his country, but was unable to save it. His last order on the day of the cataclysm was to protect the people of Khaenri'ah at all costs. During the disaster, all pure-blooded Khaenri'ahns, including Dainsleif, were cursed with immortality, while the rest were transformed into monsters, the Hilichurls. Under the curse of immortality, the Black Serpent Knights under the Twilight Sword's command lost their minds and memories, turning into empty husks that only had the will to destroy the enemy and defend. Unlike his comrades, Dainsleif was able to retain his mind using the ring left by his brother, although his body is gradually eroded, his memories fade, and he is forced to watch as the people he was supposed to protect are transformed into monsters of the Abyss. Due to the process of erosion, the Twilight Sword is forced to wear a mask, and part of his body is covered in traces of the curse. He swore vengeance on the five Sinners of Khaenri'ah, even if all memories were erased from his mind.

With Khaenri'ah destroyed, Dainsleif, along with the
of the kingdom and the other surviving knights, traveled to Sumeru, which was located above their underground kingdom. While the Schwanenritter in the giant Ruin Golems destroyed the monsters in the desert and forest, Dainsleif, together with the one-armed sage, Nagarjuna, and the first Pari, withstood the onslaught of monsters that rushed towards them like a tide. He also fought in a battle near Tunigi Hollow in the northernmost part of the desert, where the monsters emerged to the surface. Many knights of Khaenri'ah, people of Sumeru, and Pari gave their lives, and when the battle was over, the first Pari, Zurvan, found Dainsleif clutching a ring tightly in his hand. She returned with him to the Vourukasha Oasis, the homeland of the Pari, and after he awoke, they traveled together for some time, fighting the monsters that had invaded the oasis. As the monsters gradually disappeared from the face of the earth, Dainsleif and the Princess/Prince of Khaenri'ah set out on a journey to confront fate. Dainsleif first saw the Princess/Prince when he was still a young knight, and King Irmin announced a new heir. Gradually, the Princess/Prince was used as a vessel by which unlimited Abyssal power could be absorbed and became the key to the world's near-annihilation.

During their journey together, Dainsleif and the Princess/Prince went to Avidya Forest. When Dainsleif went to explore the forest, his companion met Chlothar Alberich, one of the cursed Khaenri'ahns. He immediately recognized the Princess/Prince, but did not want to reveal his true identity, so he introduced himself under a false name. In an attempt to cure their illegitimate son, Caribert, who had turned into a hilichurl, Chlothar and the Princess/Prince turned to the Sinner (Vedrfolnir), who was able to temporarily restore Caribert's sanity. Alberich hoped that with the power of the Sinner (Abyssal power), Caribert could become the "Loom of Fate" and weave his fate anew. Although the boy was not destined to survive, the idea of ​​the "Loom of Fate" was born in the thoughts of Chlothar and the Princess/Prince, so she/he didn't tell Dainsleif about the meeting with Alberich. Alberich later became the founder of the Abyss Order, which was joined by former Khaenri'ahns who became monsters of the Abyss. The monsters that serve the Abyss are the fangs and claws with which the Order sows chaos on this land. The Abyss is destruction and a morass of inconceivable madness that encroaches upon this world's very foundations. The goal of the Order was the overthrow of a world ruled by the Archons. Over time, Dainsleif's companion joined the Order, considering Dainsleif her/his enemy. In succession, she/he became known as the Princess/Prince of the Abyss Order. In turn, the Twilight Sword began to fight against the Abyss Order and the power they used to prevent them from betraying the entire world.

<color=#ffffffd9>"And that which came thereafter, where the two spirits bound by common agony would journey together, would also seem but a single point of intersection in their all-too-long, gradually diverging lives."</color>
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.text: Search of the Abyss Herald

Five hundred years of wandering and fighting against the Abyss Order led Dainsleif to Mondstadt, where, according to his information, traces of an Abyss Herald, an uglier spawn of the Abyss to whom its mages obey, were found. When the Twilight Sword appeared in Mondstadt, one of the Knights of Favonius began to follow him, but Dainsleif easily got rid of the surveillance. After that, he inquired about special forging materials from the blacksmith, Wagner, but the latter had not even heard of such materials. A suspicious man with blonde hair and a blindfold was seen in the Angels' Share tavern, where the Traveler went to find out about the stranger. When they met, Dainsleif asked for five hundred Mora and answers to three questions. First, he asked who played a key role in the victory together with the Anemo Archon over the Stormterror. The second question was, <color=#ffffffd9>"Rex Lapis, who has defended Liyue Harbor for millennia on end, used his Gnosis to lay down a Contract to End All Contracts, of which the stipulations are still unknown. Who will defend Liyue Harbor in the future, now that they've lost their deity?"</color> He asked lastly who is more important to the gods: those who have the Vision, or those who have not received it. After three answers and five hundred Mora, Dainsleif explained his goals in Mondstadt and suggested meeting at the Temple of the Falcon, which was overrun by the Abyss Order.

Although the Traveler had already encountered the Abyss Order when rescuing
it had orders to avoid the Traveler. Inside the temple, they encountered several Abyss Mages, but the Abyss Herald had already left, and they went to see the King of the North Winds, Andrius. Dainsleif knew that his
was interested in the wolf's history, so he wanted to check the place out. There had been Abyss Order activity in Wolvendom, and there were Abyss spells near Andrius's lair, but there were no signs of the Abyss Herald either. Dainsleif's last stop was Stormterror's Lair. He had been there before with the Traveler's sibling, before Dvalin had fallen and taken up residence in the ruins of Old Mondstadt. When he and the Traveler were examining the Light Actuators that once sealed this ruin, the Traveler had a "familiar feeling" that someone was watching them from the cliff. When they got there, there was no one on the cliff except for the tracks of the Ruin Guards, the machines created in Khaenri'ah. Touching a dandelion near the tracks, the Traveler suddenly remembered their sibling and the hope of returning home.

<color=#ffffffd9>"At least you now know that she/he is still on this world.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>At this time, the most important thing is the journey to find her/him itself.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>And this is something you must keep in mind as the meaning behind your journey."</color>

Finding no trace of the Abyss Herald, Dainsleif bid farewell to the Traveler and promised to meet again soon. After some time, Dainsleif's search for the Abyss Herald led him to some ruins in Liyue, where the Traveler and Paimon went after the Treasure Hoarder "Master Thief." In these ruins, the Abyss Order hid the stolen Statue of The Seven, which was not only upside down, but instead of the usual sphere, it held the energy of the Abyss in its hands. When the Traveler and Paimon found Master Thief, he was dead and sitting in front of the inverted statue, as if praying to someone. As they were leaving the ruins, the Abyss Herald appeared before them, sensing the power of the
of the Abyss Order in the Traveler. Although the Abyss Herald managed to escape, Dainsleif, upon hearing of what had happened, offered to chase him down. During the chase, they encountered Abyss Mages who were trying to find something among the energy-deprived
After the destruction of Khaenri'ah, the Field Tillers lost their masters and went completely out of control. For five centuries, they wandered aimlessly across the lands and scattered throughout Teyvat. On one of the defeated Abyss Mages, the Traveler, Paimon, and Dainsleif found a talisman that read, <color=#ffffffd9>"...Engulf the faith of the enemy in flame, and bring glory to Her Highness, the Princess/His Highness, the Prince. ...'Loom of Fate,' initial operation." The first phase of the plan was related to Osial, Overlord of the Vortex. During the Archon War, Rex Lapis defeated him and buried him under huge stone spears, but several thousand years later, Osial was reawakened and attacked Liyue. The Abyss Order wanted to use "the Defiled Statue" as a base, attaching Osial's limbs to construct a mechanized god, and the new core that shall replace the orb usually held by the Statue of The Seven would be the eye of the very first Field Tiller. Thereby imbuing the newly born god with the power to "topple the divine thrones of Celestia."</color>
Realizing that the Abyss Order was conducting preliminary tests for a large-scale operation, Dainsleif and the Traveler set out to learn more about the inverted statue and the eye of the first Field Tiller. Since the statue resembled one of the Anemo Archon Barbatos's statues, they set out for Mondstadt, but Dainsleif refused to enter the Church of Favonius.

<color=#ffffffd9>"I have no problem interacting with people. But interacting with gods... that's a different story.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>It's just my opinion, but a word of advice: Always be on your guard when around gods.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>You shouldn't place too much trust in them. But at the same time, don't go too far in the opposite direction... Don't go trying to overthrow them, or hunt them down."</color>

Long ago, the Statue of The Seven disappeared from its place without a trace, but the ministers of the church were never able to find it. In addition, there was an old story about "The Tyrant's Final Fury" — a danger that lived in the ruins of ancient Mondstadt, now known as the Stormterror's Lair. Many years ago, balls of fire would rain from the sky whenever anyone approached Old Mondstadt. People at that time believed that it was a curse laid down by the God of Storms, Decarabian, so they referred to it as "The Tyrant's Final Fury." This strange phenomenon continued for about a year. No one was ever able to solve it, and it just gradually ceased on its own. As the Traveler and Paimon were leaving the church, they heard about the attack of the Abyss Order in the vicinity of Wolvendom, so they hurried to Andrius together with Dainsleif, but the latter refused to go to the King of the North Winds again.

<color=#ffffffd9>"It's because Boreas was an ancient god, yet he willingly became a servant of The Seven.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>I cannot possibly agree with his actions. I don't desire any interaction with him."</color>

Lupus Boreas's spirit was captured by the Abyss Herald, who promised to restore his divine powers if he swore allegiance to the Abyss Order. Thanks to the intervention of the Traveler, the Order's ceremony was interrupted, and the Abyss Herald escaped again. They learned from Andrius that "The Tyrant's Final Fury" was actually a Field Tiller. He had once appeared in the arena of the King of the North Winds, who mistook the mechanism for a brave man who had challenged him. The machine could not think, but all its parts were made for killing and fighting: it could spin, fly high into the air, and shoot fireballs. Andrius was eventually able to defeat the machine, but it managed to leave the arena before it fell, heading for Old Mondstadt.

In Stormterror's Lair, Dainsleif and the Traveler discovered the first Field Tiller, and the Twilight Sword used special powers to extract the eye that the Abyss Order was hunting for and hid the eye in his body to prevent it from falling into their hands. In order to thwart the plans of the Order, Dainsleif and the Traveler went to the ruins of Liyue to destroy the inverted statue and defeat the Abyss Herald. When the Herald was about to be defeated, Dainsleif's power was blocked by the suddenly appeared Princess/Prince of the Abyss Order. They called Dainsleif an enemy and promised the Traveler to meet again when they finished their journey. When the Princess/Prince and the Abyss Herald opened a portal to disappear, Dainsleif rushed after them and teleported.

customize.name: Abyss Order
customize.desc: An organization comprised of the cursed Khaenri'ahns and non-human monsters. They are the enemies of surface civilization and thrive in many corners of the world. Their main goal is to destroy the world under the rule of The Seven.

customize.name: Loom of Fate
customize.desc: A device created by the Abyss Order that is capable of weaving Ley Lines. Using the Loom of Fate, the Atlas of the New World was created — reconstructed Ley Lines of New Khaenri'ah based on the memories of 500 years ago.

customize.name: Andrius
customize.desc: The Great Wolf King of the North, a protector of Wolvendom and one of the Four Winds.

customize.name: Dvalin
customize.desc: An Elemental Dragon and the Anemo Archon Barbatos's friend. After being poisoned by the Shadow Dragon's blood, he became known as Stormterror.

customize.name: Abyss Herald: Wicked Torrents
customize.desc:
Servants of the Abyss Order that use Hydro in combat.
These silent figures are the vanguard of the Abyss, brandishing Tidal Blades that can engulf everything in an instant, crumpling armor and obliterating heretics. They shall bring preordained damnation upon the foolish masses.

customize.name: Barbatos
customize.desc: The Anemo Archon of Mondstadt.
